vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/8dc44cf3-60c9-47e0-864c-10e028407101">VEHICLES</keyword>         <topcClas>Income, property and investment - Economics</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The Office for National Statistics (ONS) conducts a quarterly survey to collect capital expenditure data for various industry groups by asset. It is a statutory survey with a stratified random sample of approximately 26,000 to 32,000 businesses selected from the Inter-Departmental Business Register, where the strata are defined by Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) 2003 (SIC 2007 from Q1 2010) and employment size of the business.<br> <br> The net capital expenditure (acquisitions less disposals) is calculated and is grossed to give estimates for the total population for the industry groups. The estimates are deflated and then chain-linked. Following deflation, chained volume measures and current price series are seasonally adjusted.<br> <br> Results from the survey provide essential information for the National Accounts and feed into the compilation of gross capital formation.<br> <br> <i>Linking to other business studies</i><br> These data contain Inter-Departmental Business Register reference numbers.  These are anonymous but unique reference numbers assigned to business organisations.  Their inclusion allows researchers to combine different business survey sources together.  Researchers may consider applying for other business data to assist their research.<br> <br> The second edition (December 2013) includes data for 2006 - 2012. In September 2014, a data file for the first quarter of 2013 was added to the second edition.  Data for the rest of 2013 will be added to the next edition when these are available.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The survey captures the value of capital assets bought and sold. This includes total acquisitions and disposals; acquisitions and disposals of land and existing buildings, vehicles, computer hardware, and other capital equipment; acquisitions only of new building work (excluding dwellings), or other (construction) work of a capital nature, and computer software. Exploration expenditure is also collected for Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) 1110 level.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="start" date="1998-01-01T00:00:00Z">1998</timePrd>         <timePrd event="end" date="2013-01-01T00:00:00Z">2013</timePrd>         <nation>United Kingdom</nation>         <geogUnit>No spatial unit</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Institutions/organisations</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>UK Businesses registered for VAT and/or PAYE in 1998 - 2013.</universe>         <dataKind>Alpha/numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>Quarterly</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Office for National Statistics</dataCollector>         <sampProc>One-stage stratified or systematic random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>Approximately 26,000 to 32,000 businesses</deviat>         <collMode>Postal survey</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details</weight>         <cleanOps>A</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Secure data</specPerm>         <restrctn>Registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage. Controlled data requirements and conditions also apply. Further information is available from <a href='http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/accesssecurelab.aspx'>Access to the Secure Lab</a>. In addition, the Service is required to request explicit permission from the data owner prior to providing the researcher with access to the data.<br> Available to UK HE/FE applicants only. <p>Please note:<br>Since these data are more sensitive and/or pose a higher risk of disclosure than data made available under the standard End User Licence or under a Special Licence, they are not available for download but may be accessed through Secure Access. Access requires accreditation by the UK Statistics Authority as an Approved Researcher, completion of face-to-face training, and agreement to the Secure Access's <a href='http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/media/176858/ukda140_sds_sdsagreement_public.pdf'>User Agreement</a> and <a href='http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/media/176861/UKDA142_SDS_SecurityBreaches_public.pdf'>Breaches Penalties Policy</a>. This is to ensure that the guarantee of confidentiality given to survey respondents is protected. Applications are screened by the UK Data Archive and the Office for National Statistics, and access is only granted to those researchers requiring data for statistical research purposes and who can justify their need for the data. Users who obtain access to these data are required to read and follow the <a href='http://www.data-archive.ac.uk/media/132701/UKDA171-SS-MicrodataHandling.pdf'> Microdata Handling and Security: Guide to Good Practice</a>.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
